result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob Daniel Grooms was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Mental Health Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No violent contact with the victim, N.G.
Domestic Abuse Counseling.
Follow all family court orders.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change. Terminated - regular

CIVIL JUDGMENT WILL NOT BE IMPOSED FOR $2.95
Extending Probation until Domestic Violence group completed or 9/2/17, whichever comes first

Defendant Jacob Daniel Grooms in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for DOC's request to extend probation.  State requests defendant complete domestic violence counseling before being released from probation.  Defense makes argument for ending probation as scheduled.  Court orders that probation is extended 11 weeks from June 17, 2017 for the defendant to complete the domestic violence course.
Review hearing on May 31, 2017 at 09:30 am.
5/17/17 Letter from DOC requesting Defendant's probation be extended to complete counseling
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
